intro: Vachellia pilispina, commonly known as the silver acacia, is a flowering plant native to Africa, particularly found in regions such as Kenya and Tanzania. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, often thorned stems and bipinnate leaves that are feathery in appearance. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in spikes, producing a distinctive and fragrant scent. Vachellia pilispina plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
